meanings.definition: Stubbornly conservative or narrow-minded in opinion
meanings.sent1: The hidebound man refused to try any new foods, sticking only to what he knew.
meanings.sent2: She was so hidebound in her beliefs that she couldn't accept any new ideas.
meanings.sent3: The hidebound cat insisted on sleeping in the same spot every night, no matter what.
meanings.sent4: His hidebound attitude towards technology made it difficult for him to adapt to modern devices.
meanings.sent5: The hidebound tree refused to bend with the wind, standing firm in its old ways.

meanings.definition: Restricted by or as if by a tight band or binding; constricted
meanings.sent1: The hidebound book was so tightly wrapped in plastic that it was hard to open.
meanings.sent2: The hidebound jar lid wouldn't budge no matter how hard she tried to twist it.
meanings.sent3: The hidebound pants were so tight that he could barely sit down comfortably.
meanings.sent4: Her hidebound shoes were causing blisters on her feet due to the tight fit.
meanings.sent5: The hidebound rope was wound so tightly around the pole that it was difficult to untangle.
